title: The Atlantic's new heavyweight retro sans caps
content:
So far I like what I’m seeing of Pentagram’s rejuvenation! But I can’t figure out what that thick sans is.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203310im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/header08_4350.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203310im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Re-design_advicead_3530.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203310im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/728_newhousead_001_3460.gif)

 [‹ One tricky slanted O in On Clip Plus logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203310/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50273 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Hershey's Chocolate logo compact sans - Helvetica Utra Compressed {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203310/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50324 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roquestrew

comments.content: Most probably a custom typeface, quite possibly by The Font Bureau, Inc., or maybe Hoefler & Frere-Jones. Dunno for sure.
